Leaving it disabled is perfect. It doesn't obsolete the validation, though: remember all form data can be forged so it's not sufficient to rely on the `disabled` HTML attribute: it's very easy to remove the disabled flag with your DOM inspector / editor of choice. The validation will catch those forged requests.

TL;DR: it's all good with the form 👍
